misdeed: Travelers have begun to disappear in the mountains, vanishing without a trace on trails once considered safe.  The few who return speak of feeling watched, of an unnatural chill, and of seeing grotesque figures lurking in the shadows.
solution: The Vaesen are Trolls and can be driven away by Christian rituals such as placing a cross in their dwelling or uttering holy words inside their homes.

clues.description: Witnesses describe seeing strange, misshapen figures lurking in the fog and shadows, their eyes gleaming with an unsettling intelligence.
Livestock are found slaughtered and partially devoured, their bones cracked and broken as if by immense strength.
Local folklore speaks of trolls that dwell in the mountains, preying on those foolish enough to travel alone at night.
A traveler's pack is found abandoned by the trail, containing a half-eaten hunk of bread that smells faintly of moss and decay.
The temperature drops sharply in certain areas, even during the day, and the air takes on a heavy, almost suffocating quality.
Strange, guttural voices are sometimes heard echoing through the valleys, speaking in a language that chills the blood.

plotTwist.description: A group of travelers, seeking shelter from a storm, unknowingly built a fire on sacred troll ground, awakening the Vaesen from their slumber.
